availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Martin (Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Married to Catherine B. Martin. Father of Joseph M. Martin. Farmer in Fulton County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Fulton County in 1850. Farmer in Blandville in 1860. Owned thirteen enslaved persons in Blandville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fulton County, p. 119A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fulton County, p. 924.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Blandville, p. 571.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Blandville, p. 35B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, District 3, p. 402A.
"George W. Martin (1816-1883)," Find A Grave, Memorial #110621237, accessed August 18, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/110621237.
